appearances.snippet: other kind of component to to this whole hearing was that several lawmakers, including congressman jamie raskin, who is the top democrat in the house judiciary committee, he argued that it really still is january 6th and part of the through line that he illustrated to me when i talked to him yesterday ahead of this hearing, was that the lawlessness that they say the president exposed and leaned in on on january 6th, the fact that he was never held accountable for that in a public forum that has only emboldened him in round two in the oval office. >> kevin fry, thank you. i want to bring in former metropolitan police officer michael fanone, who defended the capitol that day and nearly died after he was beaten and tased by the crowd. he is an advisory board member and spokesman for home of the brave. it's good to see you, michael. i can't imagine what today is like for you. you've been on this very public but also very personal journey since the attack. where do you think we are today as a country? after five years to reflect on what happened? >> i think we're in a very dangerous place. i think t

appearances.title: The Briefing With Jen Psaki : MSNOW : January 2, 2026 5:00pm-7:01pm PST
appearances.snippet: we've also i'm tag teaming with jamie raskin on the judiciary side.ttees to take on this issue. but more broadly, the issue of trump corruption at the doj and across government. look, the epstein files is clearly something that the american public understand, but it is part of a broader agenda of trump corruption that has infected our government and is really working to destroy our norms and our democracy. and so the epstein case is critical and central to that. when you're directing the doj, when you're trying to cover up what's happening at the white house, when you're protecting men who raped and abused women and children, that needs to be exposed. and we've got to use every tool that we have as democrats and people that believe in good government to hold those folks accountable. >> congressman robert garcia, you're pretty tireless. i hope you will come back and talk with us when you have more to say about what what you're what you're all cooking up. thank you so much for joining me. okay. up next, ahead of another anniversary of january 6th, we're
